plot: An Optimal Algorithm for Certifying Monotone Functions
summary: Given query access to a monotone function $f\colon\{0,1\}^n\to\ {0, 1\}$ with certificate complexity $C(f)$ and an input $x^{\star}$ They design an algorithm that outputs a size-$C(F)$ subset of $x$x$ certifying the value of $f(x^\star)$ The algorithm makes $O(C) \cdot \log n) queries to $f$, which matches the information-theoretic lower bound for this problem.
